resources.string: Area for graphing the visual cluster
Tap screen to add data points

K-means clustering groups data points into k clusters. First, choose your data type. Next, add centroids. Then, reassign the data points and update the centroids to see where the mean is for each cluster.

Support vector machines (SVMs) are a set of supervised learning methods used for classification, regression and outliers detection. Add points to the graph and change the kernel type to see how the SVM classifies the data.

Naive Bayes methods are a set of supervised learning algorithms based on applying Bayes’ theorem with the “naive” assumption of conditional independence between every pair of features given the value of the class variable. Add points to the graph and see how the classifier responds.

Linear Regression fits a linear model to minimize the residual sum of squares between the observed responses in the dataset, and the responses predicted by the linear approximation. Add points to the screen and see how the linear model is calculated.
Logistic Regression fits a logistic model to minimize the residual sum of squares between the observed responses in the dataset. Add points to the screen and see how the logistic model is calculated.

Decision Trees (DTs) are a non-parametric supervised learning method used for classification and regression. The goal is to create a model that predicts the value of a target variable by learning simple decision rules inferred from the data features. Add points to the screen to see how they are classified.
